Posts.EditableText:
I've almost finished that game by revrevrevrev, and it's well-written and quite good.
When I say "almost finished", I mean I've currently discovered how to do (ahem) all but one of the characters (or so it seems), and got all the powers and things (unless there are more secret ones after [size=40:2jabjbr6]Jean Grey[/size:2jabjbr6]), and even finished the game victoriously. But one of the secondary sidequests eludes me. Namely, Betty Brant and J.J.J.
I've tried every power in the game on both JJJ and even Betty (manually), taked to both, and used the only useable item on them (I made a checklist and followed it just because). Nothing. 
I'd guess it would be related to the otherwise-unused power ([size=40:2jabjbr6]telekinesis[/size:2jabjbr6]) but haven't managed to achieve it.
If the author is reading this: there's any way to do that? Or are them red herrings?
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText: Excuse my newbie question, but, is there any way to contact authors? Couldn't see any in the profile page...
Posts.HTML: Excuse my newbie question, but, is there any way to contact authors? Couldn't see any in the profile page...

Posts.EditableText: If they annouce the game here in the forum then you could pm them. Most don't though. Afaik there isn't any way of contacting the author on the main site. Is it a parser game? They might have put info in the About command but I suspect most don't do that either.

Posts.EditableText: Perhaps I can help. You should wear Spider-Man's costume when you meet Betty then talk to JJJ
Posts.HTML: Perhaps I can help. You should wear Spider-Man's costume when you meet Betty then talk to JJJ

Posts.EditableText: That leaves me with the question of "where do I find a Spidy costume?"
Posts.HTML: That leaves me with the question of "where do I find a Spidy costume?"

Posts.EditableText:
It's in the dumpster in the Alley. You can open it when you have Power 2 (punching)
